result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. (bond applied - balance due)

Probation (may be served in Marathon County).
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.  
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:36 a.m. Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF194, 15CF257, and 15CF359 are heard today.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Plea to 15CF194 Count 2 and 15CF257.  15CF359 and 15CF194 Counts 1 & 3. W/H Sentence 2yr probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF194 Count 2 - No Contest
15CF257 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF194 Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CF359 and 15CF194 Counts 1 & 3 are Dismissed and Read In

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 15CF194 has 1 day credit and 15CF257 has 2 days credit.
Atty Cveykus concurs with joint recommendation. Already done AODA and is in counseling. 
Defendant makes statements.
BY THE COURT:****PROBATION*****
 15CF194
 W /H  Sentence (1 day credit, if revoked)
  2 yrs  Probation (may be served in Marathon County)
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.  
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.  
Pay costs, Drug, DNA surcharge.

15CF257 W /H  Sentence (2 day credit, if revoked)
  2 yrs  Probation, concurrent with 15CF194.
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CF194.
Pay costs, Drug, DNA surcharge.

15CV182 cash $230 forfeited and $655 returned to Defendant.  Clerk to prepare an order stating so.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus. Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: Preliminary Hearing on 15CF194.  Initial Appearance on 15CF257.
3:05 p.m. Court calls the cases. 

15CF257 Initial Appearance heard at this time: 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

15CF194 & 15CF257 Preliminary Hearing Waivers and Arraignments are heard at this time:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 11:45 am.

7/8/15 Bond amended to include that it now covers both 15CF94 & 15GF240.  Cash has been previously posted.  Conditions remain: 
Reside in the home of your father.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.   
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On all days Defendant is scheduled for Court*

Attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek Jr. appeared by video. 
  Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Bond will now cover 15GF240 as well.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Constable indicates the defendant reported to day report and tested positive so the defendant is in custody.  He was not able to appear by video earlier.  Suggests this matter be rescheduled for a continued initial appearance.  
Atty Cveykus indicates he is not available tomorrow but could make that on Wednesday. 

Court will continue to 7/08 at 1:15.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

2:23 p.m. Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek Jr. in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Defendant has consulted with an attorney. Defendant to inform his attorney of next court date.
Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Reside in the home of your father.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On all days Defendant is scheduled for Court*

ADA Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

2:20 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

ADA  Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC with intent to deliver, Possess Drug Paraphernalia and Felony Bailjumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Defendant has not been seen by the public defender's office today. Defendant is represented by a lawyer in his Marathon County case. 

Court questions Defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 cash bond  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  June 08, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Defendant requests a larger signature bond.

Thomas Bembenek is present, father of Defendant. 
Court questions Mr. Bembenek.
